column2: ALABAMA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
column4: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.
column8: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.

column2: 2. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
3. To drive defensively, you must:
column6: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 4. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column6: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.

column2: 5. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column8: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 6. If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
column6: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.

column2: 7. Drivers should always be looking:
column6: beside, ahead and to the rear of the vehicle.
column8: directly in front of the car.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column8: Bicycles are not allowed in this area

column2: 9. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
10. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and then stop.
column6: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column8: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 11. Blind spots are:
column4: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column6: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column8: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.

column2: 12. In work zones, barriers such as drums, panels and cones are used to:
column6: keep traffic out of hazardous work zones.
column8: keep workers out of the work zone.

column2: 13. Stopping distances:
column4: are not affected by vehicle speed.

column2: 14. A curb painted red means:
column6: Parking is for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.
column8: Reserved for passengers pick up or drop off

column2: 15. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column6: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 16. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane:
column4: when you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.
column8: when you see the front bumper of the other vehicle in your mirror.

column2: 17. When driving at night, drivers should:
column8: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.

column2: 18. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear

column2: 19. The driver is about to:
20. When changing lanes, you should remember that:
column4: vehicles with two outside mirrors have no blind spots.
column6: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.
column8: you should look over your left shoulder for a left lane change and your right shoulder for a right lane change.

column2: 21. Warning signs normally are:
22. Driving at night is more dangerous because:
column8: you cannot see as far ahead at night.

column2: 23. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
24. This road sign means:
25. If a vehicle is coming towards you at night with its high beams on, making it hard to see the road ahead, you should:
column4: look straight ahead towards the middle of the lane.
column6: look ahead towards the left edge of your lane.
column8: look ahead towards the right edge of your lane.

column2: 26. These are:
27. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 28. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column6: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column8: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
30. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column6: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column8: wait until traffic ahead is clear.

column2: 31. When the road is slippery you should:
32. Some roadway surfaces are more slippery during certain times or at certain places. Which of the following is more likely to be slippery on cold, wet days?
33. The road is the most slippery:
column4: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 34. This road sign means:
35. This road sign means:
36. When you change lanes:
column4: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column8: look in the left side mirror.

column2: 37. Drivers should not sound their horn when:
38. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column6: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column8: tap the gas pedal with their foot.

column2: 39. Who is most at risk?
column6: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 40. Which shape is a yield sign?
